body.p: To His Excellency Governor Thos" E. Bramblet

We the Undersigned Citizens of Bath would respectfully represent that George ^A.^ Bean was at the Sept. term 1861 fined $40.00 for standing a Jack without License. It appears that said Bean had a License issued by the Clerk of the Montgomery County Court, and at the trial of his the indictment said Beans attorney failed or forgot to make defense and show his license which would have kept him for being fined, as he had not violated the law.
This is one of the case which deserves the exercise of remitting power.

December 1st 1863.
V. B. Young C. B. C. C

James Cutt
Danel Hasper
Thos. F. Gudgel
W Taylor
T. W. Ewing
B. F. Trumbo
R. Coulthard
Geo ^A^ Bean says that the statements of the foregoing petition to his Excellency Gov. Thos. E. Bramblett. are true --
Sworn to before me by G. A. Bean this 21st December 1863.
R. Gudgell Notary Public Bath Co

Bath Cir Ct
George A Bean
Petition

Remit except fees & costs
T E Bramlette
